summary: The Toxic-Free Beauty Act of 2025 amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to ban specific substances in cosmetic products. It prohibits the use of intentionally added ortho-phthalates and formaldehyde-releasing preservatives, and lists a range of intentionally added ingredients and contaminants (including 1,4-dioxane, lead, and asbestos) that are also banned. The bill defines key terms, clarifies non-preemption for state regulations, and sets an effective date of January 1, 2027.
